block.p: Francine Hirsch, the daughter of Lois and Mark Hirsch of Greenridge, Staten Island, is to be married today to Mark Hessman, the son of Erika Hessman and Dr. Lawrence Hessman of Andover, Mass. Rabbi Stephen Stern is to officiate at the Snug Harbor Cultural Center on Staten Island.

Ms. Hirsch, 33, will keep her name. She was until this month an assistant professor of Russian and Soviet history at the State University at Binghamton. In the fall, she is to begin teaching the same subjects at the University of Wisconsin. She graduated magna cum laude from Cornell and received a master's degree in Russian studies and a master's and Ph.D. in Russian and Soviet history from Princeton.

The bride's father is a facilities manager and a second vice president at the Chase Manhattan Bank in New York. Her mother is an operations analyst in the accounting department at Chase.
The bridegroom, 31, is a senior Web applications consultant for Genuity, a Burlington, Mass., company, which provides Internet services to corporations. He graduated magna cum laude from Brown.

The bridegroom's father, a gastroenterologist in Chelmsford, Mass., is a clinical instructor in medicine at the Tufts University School of Medicine in Boston. His mother is an administrator for her husband's practice.
